tripreview.Title: "History"
tripreview.sentence: Take in a moment.
Breathe deeply and start walking.
It has a lovely feel about it.
This place is about soaking in.
Nothing else.

tripreview.Title: "Loved the feel of the place"
tripreview.sentence: If you like to walk around quaint places, don't miss a trip to Jew Town.
There are lovely shops selling handicrafts, books and soaps, and one brand that I really fell in love with is Via Kerala.
You can include a few more places like Fort Kochi and see the Chinese fishing nets, visit the Basilica and Vasco da Gama's resting place, and a nice little day trip of Kochi is what you'll have.

tripreview.Title: "A different kinda crowd ."
tripreview.sentence: This place has a different kinda crowd.
It is still the same as I had visited many years ago .
There are beautiful shops but unfortunately the shopkeepers can get rude if you dont buy anything from them.

tripreview.Title: "Fascinating historic district"
tripreview.sentence: One of the attractions of Cochin, this area offers small local temples where the novice is guided through the proper blessing protocols, great shopping, and local people from business men to - yes - blind beggars.
Walking a little bit out of the center you pass through residential areas where the people are very friendly and welcoming.
I think they are used to having pictures taken by tourists.
It is appropriate to give children small gifts of pencils/pens or candy - money is discouraged as it fosters an attitude considered negative.

One small down side: my friend's young daughter and I were followed by an importunate moto-rickshaw driver who would not take "No" for an answer until I said something rude to him in Spanish - the only such experience I had in India.
Otherwise, delightful although crowded and a bit scruffy.
I would have liked go inside the British Colonial Coffee Exchange building (my father having been a coffee importer), but time did not allow.
A guide might be helpful, but we did fine on our own.

tripreview.Title: "Don't miss it !"
tripreview.sentence: Don't miss this place if you visit Kochi.
It would be a wonderful experience if you can catch a boat from the Marine Drive boat jetty to Mattanchery.
There is also a conducted tour ( with a good english speaking guide ) by KTDC ( Kerala State Tourism Development Corporation ) which starts from Marine drive.

tripreview.Title: "not much to see"
tripreview.sentence: It was interesting to see Arab merchants filling the streets leading to the only Jewish Synagogue in town.
but there was not much to visit at the Synagogue, the lady at the entrance seemed only interested in collecting the entrance fees than anything else.

tripreview.Title: "Mehh"
tripreview.sentence: The main attraction here is the shopping and the synagogue, and I am not a big shopper.
Be aware that the synaoguge is closed every day (i think) during mid-day hours.

tripreview.Title: "Experiences of Jewish culture"
tripreview.sentence: A wonderful community laid out in Jewish style, with excellent jewellery, handicrafts, antiques shops.
Leads to the Jewish synagogue - encapsulation of Jewish tradition of worship with flooring tiles from China and if you are lucky you can get permission to see the Jewish Bible Scroll.

tripreview.Title: "kool place to hangout.."
tripreview.sentence: kool place to hangout.
nice restaurant .
perfect place to shop for antiques and furniture .
Got chance to see 108 years old snake boat.

tripreview.Title: "VISTED FOR TWELVE YEARS RUNNING"
tripreview.sentence: Give it a try.
Excellent jewellery and handicraft stores.
Tobacco shop that sells drum, Golden virginia and Old Holborn at 3dollar a pack ( 50 g) Visit Sarah Cohen and her shop for Jewish items and hand crafted items.
A lovely lady.
The synagogue is lovely, ensure your shoulders are covered and if wearing shorts make them longer ones.
Goats running wild, lovely to photograph.
Mixture of races and religions all getting on.
Spices, clothing, wooden items, bronzes, something for everyone.
Worth a visit.
Auto rickshaws safe and exciting, only 15 minutes at about 31 from The Chinese fishing nets for three people squeezed in.

tripreview.Title: "time machine"
tripreview.sentence: lil shops with all th eantiques,overpriced stuff,but then thats what antiques re all about right?
an old world charm with the typical buzzle of crowded kerala.

tripreview.Title: "we got there too late (25 years I suspect)"
tripreview.sentence: interesting enough, nice little jetty, but now so many tourists every business is there for you and your wallet so typically Indian like Times Square is typically American.

tripreview.Title: "Mattancherry Town, Cochin"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is one of the oldest market in the Kerala State; it was centre for export of spices, Lemon Grass Oil, Cashew Nut, Nut Mugs etc couple of centuries back.
From here these exports were mainly to Europe, America and Gulf countries, where there were a good business relationship.
Old market area is still alive, one could also see British rule Buildings of historical importance around.
Worth fr history lovers!

tripreview.Title: "Good Place"
tripreview.sentence: This place is surrounded with lots of shops selling spices and handicrafts.

tripreview.Title: "Spice Market In Kerala"
tripreview.sentence: This place is local city in Kochi, it located in Kerala, India.
This is very near to Fort Kochi and this place is surrounded by lots of spices and handicrafts shops.
It is about 9 km from Ernakulam town.
There are frequent bus and boat services to Mattancherry from Ernakulam town.

tripreview.Title: "Spice Bazar"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is an area in Fort Kochi and is primarily a spice market.
Visit for souvenirs and spices.

tripreview.Title: "Spices, and Handicrafts"
tripreview.sentence: This place is surrounded with lots of shops selling spices and handicrafts.
They charge a small fee for entrance.
But photographs are not allowed.

tripreview.Title: "Spices"
tripreview.sentence: Nice area with many old houses.
There is an nice artgalery in basarroad and streetart.
In palaceroad you can go shoppping and there are a few hindutempels you can visit.
The jaintempel is there and you can feed pigeons 12 o clock.

tripreview.Title: "Ginger House Restaurant"
tripreview.sentence: Hidden behind a massive antique-filled godown (warehouse) is this fantastic waterfront restaurant, where you can feast on Indian dishes and snacks ,ginger prawns, fish molli, ginger ice cream, ginger lassi and a must try is their morru curry, you get the picture.

To get to the restaurant, walk through the astonishing Heritage Arts showroom with amazing sculptures and antiques , check out the giant snake-boat canoe and various collections of antiques , A place to visit.

tripreview.Title: "Loved this area"
tripreview.sentence: Especially the area north of the tourist Jew town.
The old warehouses still being used by local businesses, fascinating area to stroll in.

tripreview.Title: "Good Place"
tripreview.sentence: The place is neat and clean.
There is a small lane with shops full of kashmiri handicrafts and other gift items.

tripreview.Title: "Best place for shopping for spices"
tripreview.sentence: The roads are narrow and busy at all times of the day.
This is the best place to come to if you want to do some spice and handicraft shopping.
The streets are dotted with Kashmiri shops selling you everything from Pashimas to jewellery.

tripreview.Title: "Good place for spices"
tripreview.sentence: You get really fresh spices here and at cheaper rates than city rates.
It was a beautiful experience

tripreview.Title: "Handicrafts and Antiques"
tripreview.sentence: This is located in the Jew town and best known for handicrafts and Antiques.
You will find 1000s of antiques here.
but just be careful
everything that looks old is not antique.

tripreview.Title: "Mattancherry"
tripreview.sentence: Mattamcherry is a locality in Ernakulam situated at adistance of 10 kms from Ernakulam Town.
There are frequent buses and Boats from Boat jetty to reach this place.
In addition, private vehicles, cabs, tourist buses are available for transportation.
The name has derived from words, Cherry meaning Street with full of mutton butchers and gradually being known as Mattancherry.
Earlier Mattancherry was a trade link to Ernakulam dealing with spices like tamarind and pepper.
Due to local problems, this trade is shifted to Ernakulam.
The main attraction at this place is International Tourism Police Museum.
Thousands of visitors visit this place making it an important tourist place.

tripreview.Title: "Disappointed"
tripreview.sentence: I had visited this place on a Friday.
Unfortunately Friday and Saturday's they close all Synagogue and Palace by noon.
So, if you are planning make a note of this.
Apart from these 2 things there isn't much to see.
Probably this place is worth for couple of hours and not more that.

tripreview.Title: "Island with most tourist attractions"
tripreview.sentence: You will land in Mattancherry if you want to see the Synagogue, Mattancherry palace etc.
If one is staying at Kochi / Ernakulam hotels, a short 20 minute ferry ride costing Rs 7 per head will get you here.
By cab or car will take more than an hour in the dusty and polluted traffic.
The place is like any tourist one with lots of vendors.

tripreview.Title: "waste of time"
tripreview.sentence: well it was a big market like a few decades back, but right now this place has become sad.
no development, same old people, same old attitude and same old place.
even the roads are horrible.

tripreview.Title: "Lively area lots to see"
tripreview.sentence: Great for wandering around shops and streets; architecture and atmosphere.
The Palace museum is a must.

tripreview.Title: "Beautiful and calm place to live !!"
tripreview.sentence: I have visited this beautiful place which has several by lanes and small bungalows type structures and many temples in area.

tripreview.Title: "Raw and Antique Streets"
tripreview.sentence: You might not have a five star facilities in Mattancherry, but for sure you can hand shake a good lot of people here, always lending helping hand 7 around for any service.

tripreview.Title: "Lovely side of Fort Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: What a great walk through the Spice Market, all the shops with their vibrant spices, essential oils, art, collectibles, etc.
It was a lovely afternoon sprinkled with amazing sights and generous locals.
Must do if in Fort Kochi!

tripreview.Title: "Great place for restaurants!"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is a great place for restaurants and hotel dining.
You'll also find a number of Halal restaurants with family seating/eating areas in this locality.

tripreview.Title: "Calm and clean"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is famous for Pardesi Synagogue and Dutch Palace.
It is a very clean and beautiful town near Fort Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Cochin at its best"
tripreview.sentence: Good Shopping Destination.
The place has two attractions one is the Mattancherry palace and the synagogue which is just walking distance from the palace.
The place is calm and clean with lot of spice and artifact shops.

tripreview.Title: "Clean and calm place"
tripreview.sentence: The place has two attractions one is the Mattancherry palace and the synagogue which is just walking distance from the palace.
The place is calm and clean with lot of spice and artifact shops.
the mattancherry palace is a museum and there is an Rs 5 entry charge for people above 15 years of age.
Camera is not allowed and people are asked to switch of mobile phones.

tripreview.Title: "Quaint Gorgeous Neighbourhood. "
tripreview.sentence: Walk around this neighbourhood.
It is less touristy and had gorgeous buildings, quaint streets and it is fun to people watch ;) Such a treat.
And so clean.

tripreview.Title: "A paradise for spice,curio and article hunters."
tripreview.sentence: This is one place you will get mad with, with the variety of stuff available around.
Malabar spices, vintage articles, curios, girly fashinwear and what not.
My betterhalf was fescinated by the cross stitch products but were very expencive.

tripreview.Title: "Mattancherry"
tripreview.sentence: As you enter Mattancherry in Fort Kochi, you are transported to another old world charm.
Mattancherry is very famous for the oldest Jewish Synagogue and spice and antiques market.

tripreview.Title: "A must visit place in Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is famous for having Jew Town, Mattancherry Palace (Dutch Palace) and Paradesi Synagogue (India's oldest functioning Synagogue) in its heart.
Also you can find Spices and Antiques in and around shops.

tripreview.Title: "Different world"
tripreview.sentence: Once you enter Mattancherry, you get a feeling like you just entered a different world.
Especially the streets and jew town in Mattancherry.

tripreview.Title: "Endless number of wonderful views and experience"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is a locality in the city of Kochi, India.
It is a tourist destination.
It is surrounded by the backwaters of Arabian Sea.

Mattancherry was the first trade hub of the present district, it is also home to the Paradesi Synagogue (India's oldest functioning synagogue), Mattancherry Palace Museum, Mattancherry Pazhayannur Royal temple and Palliarakkavvu temple, Ram Mandir, Gowd Saraswat Brahmin samaj temples including the Venkatraman temple and a Jain Temple and Mosques.
Mattancherry is famous for having "Jew Town" in its heart.
This is a historical part of India, where the ancient Jews started their trading.
This neighborhood is now famous for antique showrooms.

HERITAGE ARTS is one of the leading antique store, with 1 lakh square feet, where a huge collection of Antique Furniture, Crafted Goods, Paintings, Indian Handicrafts, Sculptures, Odd Curios, Practical Household Articles and Ancient Archaic Showpieces.
It is a great experience to see all those infrequent and unique articles.
Also, the nearby restaurant GINGER HOUSE RESTAURANT acclaimed as the finest heritage restaurant, nestles on the serene banks of the Arabian Sea.
It offers the perfect rustic ambience to suit the typical Kerala cuisine, as one basks in the view of a glorious backwater.

tripreview.Title: "A refreshing walk"
tripreview.sentence: Mattanchery is not a big place, but beautiful.
Good handicrafts, good food and avid pictures of culture and travel.
I use to take a passenger boat from Ernakulam Jetty to Fort Kochi and walk to Mattanchery.
It is almost 3 KM.
But you can have some great view of graffiti and old houses (Malikapuras).
Its really a good expirience.
You can have food from Kaikka's Hotel, which has a signature of Mattanchery.
Hope you enjoy!

tripreview.Title: "Jew town"
tripreview.sentence: Nice place with lots of shops.
The main attraction is the synagogue.
Overall, you may visit this place for once.

tripreview.Title: "Spice Trail"
tripreview.sentence: This area is close to the famed Jewish quarters of Cochin.
It is known for the wide variety of spices and souvenirs that are available in the shops located here.

tripreview.Title: "Palace Road, Matancherry"
tripreview.sentence: Interesting mix of shops, ayurvedic clinics and the fabulous Sree Krishna Cafe which serves delicious food for very good prices.
Fascinating to walk along that road.
Everything available for all tastes and price ranges!

tripreview.Title: "As advertised"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is a quaint little area in the heart of Kochi which is a good introduction to the city.

tripreview.Title: "Good place.."
tripreview.sentence: A cool place to visit if you are in Kochi.
walk around the streets and browse along the shops for souveniers.

tripreview.Title: "Fort Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: walk around the streets and browse along the shops for souveniers.

tripreview.Title: "A walk through the old jewish town"
tripreview.sentence: Walk the way through and bargain everything you want to purchase.
From antiques to best fashion jewelry.

tripreview.Title: "The feel of Kochi"
tripreview.sentence: Mattanchery is the place one must visit to get the feel of Kochi.
The highlight has to be a visit to the Dutch Palace where the Maharajas of Kochi were coronated.
The area abounds with quaint buildings.

tripreview.Title: "It's Nice"
tripreview.sentence: More famous for Jew Town and Jew Street, Mattancherry is a nice place to spend half a day.
Your first feel is lovely views of the sea, when driving across the old bridge.
If you begin your day in Mattancherry early, you could end it with lunch at one of the many eating places.

tripreview.Title: "Not bad"
tripreview.sentence: Considering the many historically relevant places in the region, this was alright.
Some interesting things to see.
The huge stairs might be a problem for old people.

tripreview.Title: "THE HERITAGE STREET OF KERALA"
tripreview.sentence: A vibrant historical area which show cases the variety of kochis international trade from 16 century AD, The centre of spice trade,seat of kochi maharaja, the sanctuary of all minorities who were affected by the portugese agression,,all can be visible even today.
the popular jewish synagogue and dutch palace are situated in this area.

tripreview.Title: "High expectation - short lived"
tripreview.sentence: Nothing much on offer but an old and small Dutch Palace as its called, not bigger than an old bungalow.

No photography allowed and the whole trip would get over even before it starts, If you have old people coming along, please be aware the walk thru is only on the first floor and one has to climb a steep stairway of 20-25 steps.
However there is a small flea market just outside for all those who are in to pick some memories.

tripreview.Title: "a passage"
tripreview.sentence: walk for boat jetty to police museum.
don't use transportation .

tripreview.Title: "A Historical Area"
tripreview.sentence: A must visit, if ever in Cochin, as it is a place full of history and people are still living in a very modest way.

There is so much to see in this historical place, unfortunately we had only a little time, but made full use of it and it was well worth the visit as we learnt so many things that we did not know before.
The people in Kerala and Cochin are very nice people.
Well worth a visit.

tripreview.Title: "Excellent Museum"
tripreview.sentence: It is a museum converted from a palace.
It has murals of the Ramayana.
Also, it covers the entire history of Kerala, right from the start.
It's an eye opener.
We as Indians know very less about our country.
It has such a rich and profound culture and history.

tripreview.Title: "Mattancherry is a must visit place."
tripreview.sentence: A place one must visit when visiting Kochi for the first time.
Oldest settlement has quite different and cute urban set up.

tripreview.Title: "Street art in abundance!"
tripreview.sentence: Really cool little area, lots of very interesting artists and art gallery and heaps of amazing street art which we greatly enjoyed exploring!

tripreview.Title: "Back To Time"
tripreview.sentence: It is as if you have boarded a Time machine and traveled a century backwards.
You will see antiques that are displayed for sale on either side of the road.

tripreview.Title: "Spice market ... Fishing auction"
tripreview.sentence: This area in Fort Cochin area is famous for Dutch palace , Spice market and Fishing , a small beach area and some food joints .
Yes if in Cochin
you have to visit this area , as most of the happenings are in and around this place in Cochin , otherwise there is nothing much in Cochin other Than Fort Cochin .

tripreview.Title: "Ancient city"
tripreview.sentence: Ancient town.
Old building and quiet place.
The people seems to be lovely here.
Very polite and helpful.
Be careful when you do purchase, as prices are too high.
Negotiate the prices or else you become the looser.

tripreview.Title: "Great to see some history here."
tripreview.sentence: A perfect place for a stroll around the streets and sights of the old part of this area, the history of trade and migration, the Jews, Portuguese, Dutch and British apart from all the other communities who have also worked here.
Interesting and delightful to walk around.
Some of the shops however are well overpriced, you'd be better going elsewhere to buy.

tripreview.Title: "History buffs would lvoe this ancient corner"
tripreview.sentence: little changed over the centuries this corner of Fort Cochin offers you a chance for quiet introspection in between the water and the spices and the noises and architecture.

tripreview.Title: "Wander"
tripreview.sentence: Worth wandering around, and you'll probably find things to buy as well.
I loved the old buildings.
Wander for half-a-day.

tripreview.Title: "Tourist must"
tripreview.sentence: Nice place with a unique feel to it.
There are lot of tourist atraction around.
The antiwue shops are great tp browse.

tripreview.Title: "Spice market"
tripreview.sentence: If you do not go to Mattancherry then the visit to cochin would be incomplete.
All the historical points are in this area.
Better take a hotel in this area.

tripreview.Title: "Full of history"
tripreview.sentence: A historical part of Kochi.
Has lot of culture and heritage associated with this area.
Arrival of Jews 2000 years ago, settlement of the Portuguese, Dutch and British in Mattancherry from 1500 AD onward has added great richness to the history of Kochi.

tripreview.Title: "Walking"
tripreview.sentence: Mattancherry is an area just 3 to 4 km from fort kochi.
One can also reached by ferry to Ernakulam.
Its basicaly an old area with lots of antique shop,cafes and many heritage building.
The best way to enjoy Matancherry is by walking.
Walk along markets,Jews town (though what i know there are no jews now).
Dutch palace and Jews Synogaug can be visited.
There are many shop selling spices but i found it expensive.
Broadway in Ernakulam is better place to buy spices.

tripreview.Title: "Spice/Antique Market, Jewish Synagogue and thats about it"
tripreview.sentence: Visit a must only if you are interested in antiques, buying spices or visiting the so called historical places.
Near by Fort Kochi offers a beach with the Chinese fishing nets and a couple of old churches.

tripreview.Title: "Great market to find spices and antiques"
tripreview.sentence: walk down to just window shop amazing antique art pieces collected for years together
and shell out some moolah if you want to own them.
bargain some, but not like Delhi.
the place has some nice cafes by the waters too
and some great places for picking up south Indian spices that are fresh!

tripreview.Title: "mattanchery- a really anglo indian town"
tripreview.sentence: i dont know whats the speciality of this town
bt its beautifull
all buidings are close to road
its a love place

tripreview.Title: "A palace to remember."
tripreview.sentence: Take the boat and envoy this island off Cochin.
Don't LOI too closely at the water in the bay
Some of it seems alive.
This palace really deserves to hype fulky refurbished.
Sadly it deteriorates from year to year.
